myfunctions package¶

Submodules¶

myfunctions.heatequation module¶

myfunctions.heatequation.heat1D_solver(dx, dt, L, t, T0, BC, alpha)[source]¶

Solves the 1D heat equation with Dirichlet boundary conditions on the domain [0,L]

Parameters:
  • dx (float) – Spatial grid size
  • dt (float) – Temporal grid size
  • L (float) – Length of the domain
  • t (tuple, list, np.array) – Initial and final time provided as an interval [t0, tFinal]
  • T0 (float) – Initial temperature
  • BC (tuple, list, np.array) – Boundary temperatures provided at the tuple [LeftTemperature, RightTemperature]
  • alpha (float) – Thermal diffusivity
Returns:

  • x (np.array) – Vector containing finite difference gridpoints
  • t (np.array) – Vector containing discretised time
  • T (np.array) – Array containing computed temperature; each row corresponds to a given timestep and each column corresponds to a spatial gridpoint

myfunctions.integration module¶

myfunctions.integration.myfunc(x)[source]¶

Returns the value of the defined function at the input point x

Parameters:x (float, int) – Point at which function is to be evaluated
Returns:y – Function value at input point x
Return type:float
myfunctions.integration.mytrapz(x, y)[source]¶

Calculates approximation to the integral of a function over the domain with spatial points \(x\) using the trapezium rule. The spacing between spatial points is assumed uniform with grid size \(h\) and the integral \(I\) is approximated by

\[I = \frac{h}{2}(y_{0} + y_{N} + 2\sum_{i=1}^{N-1} y_{i})\]

where \(h\) is calculated by \(x_1-x_0\).

Parameters:
  • x (float) – Spatial points for the domain of integration. Grid size is assumed uniform and calculated by \(x_1-x_0\).
  • y (float) – Function points calculated at the spatial points in \(x\). Each element of the list \(y_i\) is the function evaluated at \(x_i\).
Returns:

result – Approximation to the integral of the function.
Return type:

float
